Description: Parts of a sheet of papyrus with hieratic text in black ink; part of a Late Ramesside Letter; in its condition as conserved and registered it consisted of two larger pieces and four adjacent minor fragments. All are now joined with 75019 and 75020, and the frame is empty.
Excavator/field collector: Field Collection by: William John Bankes
Curator's comments: William John Bankes travelled in Egypt in 1815-1818, and is known to have collected papyri at Thebes on his second journey to Upper Egypt (1818). This papyrus is from a batch of Late Ramesside Letters acquired in 1818 by Bankes.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (139355) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/139355)
Taylor et al 2011 / The history and conservation of the papyrus of Tuy (p.98)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: magic tape Binding: self adhesive tape Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: A Curatorial condition comment: torn but solid
